summary: "One Hundred Years of Solitude" is a famous novel by Colombian writer Gabriel García Márquez. Published in 1967, it tells the story of the Buendía family over many generations, starting with their founder, José Arcadio Buendía, who created the imaginary town of Macondo. The book is known for its magical realism, blending regular events with fantastical ones. It's considered one of the best books ever written in Spanish and has been translated into many languages, selling over 50 million copies.
title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
